Author: Postom

Comment: Many Americans are in the market via their 401K retirement vehicles and they can't just opt of of the market that easily. So there are thousands of fund managers who are going to still pump money into the market and attempt to make their portfolios grow.   They try to say the fundamentals haven't changed so get back in there and get some of those bargain stocks!  But the fundamentals *have* changed. The reputation of the US as a reliable and stable trading partner is gone and that is a foundational piece of the American economy. That reputation can't just bounce back, it takes decades to build a good reputation.
Author: MangroveWarbler

Comment: Definitely. Many of those who live by the market are coping hard right now, thinking "OK, the downturn is over, everyone get back in the pool so I can keep making money!"  But the harsh reality is that businesses can't plan with this amount of uncertainty. Not only that but global businesses can't rely on US markets to be stable anymore so they are routing around the US as much as they can.   Many international customers that the US is losing now, especially in the food sector, are never coming back. Canadian businesses won't be coming back for quite some time.  Sure it's easy to take a baseball bat to a TV, but putting it back together again is a much more difficult task. This is a lesson the dipshits have to learn the hard way. I just wish they could learn it without dragging us along with them.
Author: MangroveWarbler
